knimeNode.name: One-way ANOVA
knimeNode.shortDescription: The one-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) allows to test if any of several means are different from each other.

fullDescription.intro: Computes statistics for the one-way analysis of variance (ANOVA). It is designed to compare the means of observations in the same column between several groups. The node allows the testing of equality of variances (Levene's test) and the t-value for both equal- and unequal-variance. It also provides the relevant descriptive statistics.
fullDescription.option: Column holding the grouping information data.
The limits for the confidence interval are computed using this number. The default is 95 which means that you can be 95% confident that the true value of the parameter is in the confidence interval.
A two sample t-test is performed separately for each of these columns.

views.view: Tables with descriptive statistics of the input columns and test statistics of the independent samples t-test.
